headline: PokÃ©mon Drops a Fire Starter â€” Degens Mint It in 90 Seconds
subheadline: $Pombon hits Jupiter's Runners list hours after PokÃ©mon Winds & Waves reveals Gen 10's fire-type Pomeranian. Up 18,591% while the PokÃ©mon Company is still on its press tour.
author: MemeDesk Editorial

tokenData.name: Pombon
tokenData.recentAction: +18,591% in 6 hours after PokÃ©mon Gen 10 reveal. Jupiter Runner with 86.3 organic score.

body.text: At approximately 14:35 UTC on February 27, 2026 â€” roughly ninety seconds after The PokÃ©mon Company revealed the Gen 10 fire-type starter Pombon during its 30th anniversary PokÃ©mon Presents broadcast â€” someone had already deployed a $Pombon token on pump.fun. Within six hours, it graduated to Jupiter's Runners list with an 18,591% gain, $4.52 million in volume, and an organic score of 86.3 out of 100.

This isn't just another animal meme coin riding a trending hashtag. This is the collision of the world's largest media franchise with the fastest token deployment infrastructure ever built. And the numbers suggest it's not just bots.

bullets: Market cap $1.15M with $4.52M in 24h volume â€” a 3.9x volume-to-mcap ratio signaling extreme velocity
Organic score 86.3/100 (high) on Jupiter's metric â€” majority of volume from real wallets, not snipers
Catalyst: PokÃ©mon Winds & Waves Gen 10 games revealed today at the 30th anniversary event. Pombon â€” the fire-type Pomeranian â€” instantly became the internet's new obsession

body.text: From Pump.fun to Jupiter Runners: The 90-Second Sprint

The timeline tells the story better than any chart. At 14:34 UTC, The PokÃ©mon Company's PokÃ©mon Presents livestream reached its climax: the reveal of PokÃ©mon Winds and PokÃ©mon Waves, the 10th generation mainline games launching in 2027 on Nintendo Switch 2. Three new starter PokÃ©mon were unveiled â€” Browt (grass-type bird), Gecqua (water-type gecko), and Pombon, the fire-type Pomeranian that immediately stole the show.

By 14:34:35 UTC â€” before the stream had even cut to the next segment â€” a pump.fun token named Pombon was live on Solana. The first pool was created. By 14:35:47 UTC, it had graduated from pump.fun's bonding curve to a full Raydium AMM pool. That's 72 seconds from deployment to graduation.

The speed isn't surprising. Pump.fun deployers have bots monitoring every major cultural event â€” Super Bowl ads, presidential tweets, Elon posts, and yes, PokÃ©mon reveals. What's surprising is what happened next: the token didn't immediately dump after the initial sniper wave. Instead, it kept climbing. Through 15:00 UTC. Through 16:00 UTC. Through 17:00 UTC. By 19:00 UTC, it had attracted 7,231 unique traders, 29,165 buy transactions against 25,842 sells, and accumulated $4.52 million in total volume.

events.event: PokÃ©mon Presents reveals Pombon as Gen 10 fire-type starter
Token graduates from bonding curve to Raydium AMM â€” 72 seconds

body.text: The Numbers

The raw trading data paints a picture of genuine two-way market activity, not a coordinated pump-and-dump. Over the six-hour window from launch to Runner status, buy volume totaled $2.27 million against $2.25 million in sell volume â€” near-perfect equilibrium with a slight buy bias. Organic buy volume (from non-bot wallets) came in at $224.5K versus $211.6K in organic sells, with 385 distinct organic buyers making deliberate purchase decisions.

The one-hour snapshot at scan time showed the token stabilizing: price change of just -0.49%, with 3,447 buys versus 3,375 sells. Holder count was still growing at 2.6% per hour, reaching 2,649 holders. The volume-to-mcap ratio of 3.9x is elevated but not absurd for a sub-24h token â€” it signals active speculation without the hallmarks of wash trading.

Total supply sits at approximately one billion tokens on Solana's Token-2022 program. The token price settled at $0.001147, giving a fully diluted market cap of $1.15 million with $234.7K in liquidity. The liquidity-to-mcap ratio of 20.5% provides decent depth for a pump.fun graduate, though a large sell order would still cause significant slippage.
Who's Calling It

This is where the story gets interesting â€” and arguably more bullish than a typical runner. As of press time, there are no confirmed mid-to-large CT (Crypto Twitter) KOL calls on $Pombon. No Ansem tweet. No Murad thread. No Hsaka chart annotation. The token's linked Twitter account (@igochrispaul) appears to be the deployer's personal account, not a dedicated project page.

But here's the thing: the absence of KOL coordination is actually the signal. This token's volume is coming from organic retail â€” people who watched the PokÃ©mon Presents, saw the Pomeranian, and immediately searched for the token. The 385 organic buyers (out of 7,231 total traders) and the 86.3 organic score confirm this isn't being driven by call groups or alpha chats.

The PokÃ©mon community is doing the marketing for free. Reddit's r/pokemon, r/Pomeranians, and r/TheSilphRoad are all buzzing with Pombon fan art, memes, and excitement. 'POMBON FAM RISE UP!!!' is already a top comment on the TheSilphRoad thread about the Gen 10 reveal. When that energy spills over into CT â€” which historically takes 12-24 hours for mainstream cultural events â€” the second wave of volume typically follows.

The counter-argument: without KOL backing, there's no whale floor. If the initial hype fades before CT picks it up, this could bleed out like every other event-driven token. The 48-72 hour window between the PokÃ©mon announcement and the news cycle moving on is the critical variable.
Who's Behind It

The deployer wallet (bwamJz...fSXa) has 386 dev migrations and 69,111 dev mints recorded in Jupiter's audit data. This is a serial deployer â€” someone (or a bot) that spins up tokens at high velocity to capture cultural moments. There's no doxxed team, no website, no Telegram group, no roadmap.

This is standard for pump.fun culture-play tokens. The value proposition isn't the team or the tech â€” it's the meme itself. $Pombon's value is directly correlated to how much the internet loves a fire-type Pomeranian PokÃ©mon, and based on today's reaction, the internet loves it a lot. The token uses Solana's Token-2022 program with both mint authority and freeze authority disabled â€” meaning no additional supply can be created and no wallets can be frozen.
Red Flags Check

safe: Mint authority disabled â€” no inflation risk
Freeze authority disabled â€” no wallet freezing
Organic score 86.3/100 â€” genuinely high for a sub-24h token
Top holders at 16.1% â€” not extreme concentration
flags: Bot holders at 42% â€” nearly half of holders are automated wallets that will dump at predetermined targets
386 dev migrations â€” serial deployer, not a project builder
No social infrastructure â€” no Telegram, website, or community management
Liquidity-to-mcap ratio of 20.5% â€” decent but not deep enough for large sells without slippage

body.text: The bot holder percentage is the biggest concern. When 42% of your holder base is automated, any coordinated exit could crater the price. The question is whether the organic 58% â€” the actual PokÃ©mon fans and meme traders â€” can absorb the selling pressure when the bots take profit. Jupiter's detection flagging 842 bot holders out of 2,649 total is elevated even by pump.fun standards.
The Organic Signal: Why 86.3 Matters

Jupiter's organic score measures what percentage of trading activity comes from genuine, non-automated wallets. It filters out known bot wallets, sniper patterns, wash trading, and coordinated group buys to isolate the 'real' demand signal. An organic score of 86.3 puts $Pombon in the top tier of runner tokens.

For context, most pump.fun graduates score between 40-60 on this metric. Tokens above 80 typically have a genuine cultural catalyst driving retail participation â€” exactly what you'd expect from a PokÃ©mon reveal watched by millions simultaneously. The organic buy volume of $224.5K represents 385 distinct organic buyers making deliberate purchase decisions. In pump.fun economics, these are the holders who tend to have the highest conviction and longest holding periods. They didn't buy because a KOL told them to â€” they bought because they love Pombon.
The PokÃ©mon Factor: Why This Isn't Just Another Meme

PokÃ©mon is the highest-grossing media franchise in human history â€” over $150 billion in total revenue, dwarfing Star Wars, Marvel, and Mickey Mouse combined. When PokÃ©mon announces new characters, they don't just trend on Twitter. They trend everywhere. Fan art floods DeviantArt within minutes. 3D printing files appear on Cults3D within hours. Plushie pre-orders crash e-commerce sites within days.

Pombon has an additional advantage over the other two starters: it's a Pomeranian. Dog-themed tokens have a proven track record in crypto â€” from DOGE to SHIB to WIF to BONK. The fire-type classification adds memetic energy ('this dog is literally on fire'). And the name Pombon is inherently catchy and meme-friendly. It's the kind of word that works as a hashtag, a ticker symbol, and a rallying cry all at once.

The risk is timing. PokÃ©mon Winds and Waves doesn't release until 2027. The initial announcement hype will fade within 48-72 hours as the news cycle moves on. The token needs to convert today's cultural moment into sustained community before the PokÃ©mon hype cools. Without a Telegram, a website, or any community infrastructure, that conversion is unlikely to happen organically. Every subsequent PokÃ©mon Winds & Waves trailer, however, represents a potential re-catalyst â€” and there will be many between now and 2027.

body.content: ðŸŸ¡ Speculative â€” $Pombon is the purest expression of what pump.fun was built for: instant tokenization of cultural moments. The PokÃ©mon 30th anniversary reveal is a legitimate global event, the organic score is genuinely impressive, and the two-way trading pattern suggests real market-making rather than a coordinated dump. But 42% bot holders, zero KOL backing, zero community infrastructure, and a cultural catalyst with a 48-72 hour shelf life make this a textbook speculative play. If CT picks it up tomorrow and a mid-tier KOL posts a chart, there's a second wave scenario. If it doesn't get that amplification, the bots will take their profit and the chart will look like every other event token. The play, if there is one, is watching for that KOL signal.

items.question: What is Pombon?
items.answer: Pombon is a fire-type Pomeranian PokÃ©mon revealed as one of three Gen 10 starters for PokÃ©mon Winds & Waves, announced on February 27, 2026 during the PokÃ©mon 30th anniversary Presents event. A meme coin of the same name was deployed on pump.fun within 90 seconds of the reveal.

items.question: Is this an official PokÃ©mon token?
items.answer: No. This is an unofficial meme token with no connection to The PokÃ©mon Company, Nintendo, or Game Freak. It's a community-created Solana token riding the cultural moment.

items.question: What is Jupiter's organic score?
items.answer: Jupiter's organic trading score measures what percentage of volume comes from real (non-bot) wallets. Pombon's 86.3/100 indicates genuinely high organic participation, suggesting retail-driven demand rather than automated manipulation.

items.question: Why is the bot holder percentage so high?
items.answer: Pump.fun tokens attract automated trading bots that snipe launches and trade programmatically. The 42% bot holder rate is elevated and represents a risk â€” these wallets will sell at predetermined targets regardless of community sentiment.
